maml:description.maml:para: Converts Unix timestamps from GuardiCore to datetime objects.

GuardiCore stores timestamps as Unix timestamps in milliseconds. This can be annoying to deal with, so the helper functions ConvertFrom- and ConvertTo-GCUnixTime are used to make the transition seamless.

maml:Description.maml:para: A Unix timestamp in milliseconds.
A Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Convert a Unix timestamp as a positional parameter.
Convert a Unix timestamp as a named parameter.
Use the pipeline to convert a Unix timestamp.

maml:description.maml:para: Converts datetime objects into Unix timestamps in milliseconds.

GuardiCore stores timestamps as Unix timestamps in milliseconds. This can be annoying to deal with, so the helper functions ConvertFrom- and ConvertTo-GCUnixTime are used to make the transition seamless.

maml:Description.maml:para: A DateTime object, or a string formatted as such.
A DateTime object, or a string formatted as such.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Convert a DateTime-formatted string as a named parameter.
Convert a DateTime object using the pipeline.

maml:description.maml:para: Authenticates with the given management server, and stores a key in a global variable called "GCApiKey". Alternatively, returns a portable key object on the pipeline for future use.

To make GuardiCore API calls, an API token must be included in the headers. Thus, this first API call must be made; it returns a token that can be used for further API calls. The token represents a user session, and has the same timeout duration. The GCApiKey variable includes this token, plus the Uri of the management server that it's authenticated with. All functions in the module that use this token are able to get the Uri and the token from this variable without further user input. If using the key as a portable object, functions can optionally take this key as input, instead of referencing the global variable.

maml:Description.maml:para: GuardiCore management server, in the format: "cus-XXXX".
Credential for authentication.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Exports the key on the pipeline instead of setting it to the global variable.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Credential for authentication.
Exports the key on the pipeline instead of setting it to the global variable.
GuardiCore management server, in the format: "cus-XXXX".
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:type.maml:name: None. This function has no pipeline output.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-GCApiKey -Server cus-XXXX -Credential api Password for user api: ******

dev:remarks.maml:para: Authenticate to the "cus-XXXX" server using the username "api". Prompts for password.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $Cred = Get-Credential api Password for user api: ******
PS C:\> $ApiKey = Get-GCApiKey -Server cus-XXXX -Credential $Cred -Export

dev:remarks.maml:para: Authenticate to the "cus-XXXX" server using a credential object, and store the result in the $ApiKey variable.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-GCDynamicLabel -LabelKey Test -LabelValue Example -Argument demo -Field name -Operation STARTSWITH

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a new label at Test: Example with one dynamic criteria: Name starts with "demo".

maml:description.maml:para: Create a segmentation policy on the management server.
Create a segmentation policy based on the given parameters on the management server. Policies can be based on label, asset, process, port, protocol, etc.

maml:Description.maml:para: The section that this policy belongs.
The action that the policy should take. For block rules, this can be either Block or Block and Alert.
The process(es) in the destination. Multiple processes represent an "or" relationship.
One or more assets in the source (multiple assets create an "or" relationship).
One or more assets in the destination (multiple assets create an "or" relationship).
The subnet(s) in the source. Multiple subnets represent an "or" relationship.
The subnet(s) in the destination. Multiple subnets represent an "or" relationship.
The name of the ruleset. Alert/block rules will add this ruleset as a tag on any generated incidents.
The comments field in the policy. Takes an arbitrary string.
Provide an external ApiKey, in place of the global GCApiKey variable.
The IP protocol(s). If both TCP and UDP are provided, the policy will match either protocol for all given ports.
The port(s) in the destination. Multiple ports represent an "or" relationship.
The port range(s) in the destination. Takes one or more arrays containing 2 integer values, representing the start and the end of each range. Multiple port ranges represent an "or" relationship.
The label(s) in the source. Takes a 2-dimensional array of labels. Inner groups represent an "and" relationship, while the outer group is an "or" relationship.
The label(s) in the destination. Takes a 2-dimensional array of labels. Inner groups represent an "and" relationship, while the outer group is an "or" relationship.
Specify source labels from a file.
Specify destination labels from a file.
The process(es) in the source. Multiple processes represent an "or" relationship.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The type of destination address; if true, the destination is an internet address. If false, the destination is a private address.
The type of source address; if true, the destination is an internet address. If false, the destination is a private address.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The action that the policy should take. For block rules, this can be either Block or Block and Alert.
Provide an external ApiKey, in place of the global GCApiKey variable.
The comments field in the policy. Takes an arbitrary string.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
One or more assets in the destination (multiple assets create an "or" relationship).
The type of destination address; if true, the destination is an internet address. If false, the destination is a private address.
The label(s) in the destination. Takes a 2-dimensional array of labels. Inner groups represent an "and" relationship, while the outer group is an "or" relationship.
Specify destination labels from a file.
The process(es) in the destination. Multiple processes represent an "or" relationship.
The subnet(s) in the destination. Multiple subnets represent an "or" relationship.
The port(s) in the destination. Multiple ports represent an "or" relationship.
The port range(s) in the destination. Takes one or more arrays containing 2 integer values, representing the start and the end of each range. Multiple port ranges represent an "or" relationship.
The IP protocol(s). If both TCP and UDP are provided, the policy will match either protocol for all given ports.
The name of the ruleset. Alert/block rules will add this ruleset as a tag on any generated incidents.
The section that this policy belongs.
One or more assets in the source (multiple assets create an "or" relationship).
The type of source address; if true, the destination is an internet address. If false, the destination is a private address.
The label(s) in the source. Takes a 2-dimensional array of labels. Inner groups represent an "and" relationship, while the outer group is an "or" relationship.
Specify source labels from a file.
The process(es) in the source. Multiple processes represent an "or" relationship.
The subnet(s) in the source. Multiple subnets represent an "or" relationship.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-GCPolicy -Section allow -Action allow -SourceInternet -DestinationAsset (Get-GCAsset "dc1") -Ruleset "Example" -Comments "Example allow policy"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create an allow policy for internet traffic going to the "dc1" asset on any port, to any process.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a saved map on the management server.

If true, the management server will send an email to the user account that created the map when the map is finished being generated.
If true, the map will include process information.
If true, this map is available to all users. By default, the map is only visible to admins.
If true, the map will resolve accurate times for connections within the time range.
Provide an external ApiKey, in place of the global GCApiKey variable.
If true, the management server will send an email to the user account that created the map when the map is finished being generated.

A filter hashtable of what to include in the map.
If true, the map will include process information.
The name of the map.
If true, this map is available to all users. By default, the map is only visible to admins.

An array of two DateTime objects, indicating the start/end time.
If true, the map will resolve accurate times for connections within the time range.

maml:description.maml:para: Publish the current policy set on the management server, including pending changes.

Publishes all pending changes on the management server, using the provided comments as the publish comments. This changes the state of any in-progress policy changes to "unchanged," and creates a new policy revision.

maml:description.maml:para: Delete a segmentation policy from the management server.
Marks a policy for removal; the changes will not go through until policy changes are published.

maml:Description.maml:para: One or more policy objects to be deleted.
Provide an external ApiKey, in place of the global GCApiKey variable.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Provide an external ApiKey, in place of the global GCApiKey variable.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
One or more policy objects to be deleted.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Remove the "Remove me" policy using the pipeline output from Get-GCPolicy.

maml:description.maml:para: Remove a saved map from the management server.
Delete one or more saved maps from the management server.

maml:Description.maml:para: One or more map objects as returned from the API.
Provide an external ApiKey, in place of the global GCApiKey variable.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Provide an external ApiKey, in place of the global GCApiKey variable.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
One or more map objects as returned from the API.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Delete the "delete me" saved map using the pipeline output from Get-GCSavedMap.

maml:description.maml:para: Remove a user from the management server.
Delete one or more users from the management server, using either raw username strings or user API objects.

maml:Description.maml:para: The username of the user to be removed, either from string or from pipeline input of user objects.
Provide an external ApiKey, in place of the global GCApiKey variable.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Return the raw result of the request.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Provide an external ApiKey, in place of the global GCApiKey variable.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Return the raw result of the request.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The username of the user to be removed, either from string or from pipeline input of user objects.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Delete the "removeme" user.

maml:description.maml:para: Update a label on the management server based on a label object input.
Given a label object as input, set the corresponding label on the management server to be equal to the input label.

maml:Description.maml:para: A label object, as given from the API.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
A label object, as given from the API.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-GCLabel -LabelKey Copy -LabelValue Me | Set-GCLabel

dev:remarks.maml:para: Set the Copy: Me label to be equal to itself.

maml:description.maml:para: Reset a user's password with a given temporary password.
Reset a user's password. The input password must meet the password complexity requirements on the management server.

maml:Description.maml:para: The user object to be reset.
The user's new temporary password.
Provide an external ApiKey, in place of the global GCApiKey variable.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Provide an external ApiKey, in place of the global GCApiKey variable.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The user's new temporary password.
The user object to be reset.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Set the password of the "resetme" user to "newpassword123!".

maml:description.maml:para: Update a policy on the management server based on a policy object input.
Given a policy object as input, set the corresponding policy on the management server to be equal to the input policy. Changes are not pushed through until the policy is published.

maml:Description.maml:para: One or more policy objects to be set.
Provide an external ApiKey, in place of the global GCApiKey variable.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Provide an external ApiKey, in place of the global GCApiKey variable.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
One or more policy objects to be set.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Set the "set me" policy to be equal to itself.

maml:description.maml:para: Update a user on the management server based on a user object input.
Given a user object as input, set the corresponding user on the management server to be equal to the input user.

maml:Description.maml:para: One or more user objects to set.
Provide an external ApiKey, in place of the global GCApiKey variable.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Provide an external ApiKey, in place of the global GCApiKey variable.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
